[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 97]
Reasoning: **Ante Up: Strategic Shop Selection**

Alright, let's take stock. We're at Ante 4, aiming for that Boss Blind with a hefty 20,000 chip requirement. With $33 in the bank, and a decent Joker setup, the pressure is on. My current Jokers are Gros Michel (+15 Mult), Egg ($28 value), Droll Joker (Flush +10 Mult, x1.5, Polychrome x1.5), Perkeo (consumable copier), and Blue Joker (+92 chips). I also have two negative "Moon" consumables, just what I want.

So, the shop: "Scholar" isn't appealing, giving a flat +20 chips and +4 Mult for Aces—not worth replacing anything. "The Lovers" is a Tarot, possibly useful, but not a priority. A "Standard Pack" is usually for thinning the deck, but I'm fine with clubs with "The Moon". "Magic Trick" Voucher is underwhelming. I'm prioritizing consistency and bankroll.

Scoring-wise, with a Level 4 Flush (80 chips, 10 mult) and the current Jokers, I'm easily clearing the boss blind with about 13,500 per hand. I have a very strong setup and two hands should clear the 20k. The "Egg" will boost my earnings each round and Perkeo will consistently copy "The Moon". The goal here is long-term scaling, not a flashy quick win.

My reroll is currently at $4. I could reroll one more time to fish for a Planet pack or Jupiter but I'm not sure if it is worth the gamble. I'm above the $25 threshold for interest.

The tricky part: if I buy "The Lovers", Perkeo might make a negative copy of it instead of "The Moon". Definitely not. I want that consistent "Moon" generation. But, if I stay at $33, I can get $5 interest. 

Okay, I think I will `round_select` to bank on the interest. With a solid setup and the "Perkeo" trigger lined up for a free "Moon" copy, there's no need to take a risk. The current Joker arrangement is optimal (Gros Michel first). I'm not messing with it, and it's all set to go.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
